intro: Erysimum eseptatum, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with linear, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are borne in racemes and are known for their strong, spicy fragrance. Erysimum eseptatum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
